snippet: A chilling inquisition aimed at The Guardian over publishing leaks highlights how, unlike the United States, Britain has no constitutional guarantee of a free press.
abstract: Editorial criticizes British parliamentary committees and police for harassing and intimidating The Guardian newspaper for its publication of information based on National Security Agency documents leaked by Edward Snowden; contends the price for printing uncomfortable truths in a free society should not be parliamentary and criminal inquisition.
lead_paragraph: A chilling inquisition aimed at The Guardian over publishing leaks highlights how, unlike the United States, Britain has no constitutional guarantee of a free press.
